header_summary:
The development team at WizardSardine has made significant strides in encrypting Liana wallet descriptors, drawing inspiration from Salvatore Ingala's publication on DelvingBitcoin. Their progress includes draft Bitcoin Improvement Proposal (BIP) contributions and implementations in Rust, aimed at enhancing security and user experience in Bitcoin transactions. The draft BIP, alongside its Rust implementation and a simple GUI, are open for community feedback to refine cryptographic methodologies, particularly concerning deterministic nonces, cipher choices, and data encoding strategies. For further details, see [GitHub for BIP](https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/pull/1951), [Rust implementation](https://github.com/pythcoiner/encrypted_backup), and [GUI repository](https://github.com/pythcoiner/bed).

Christopher Allen highlights the integration of FROST with BDK to improve Bitcoin's security through Distributed Key Generation (DKG) and Schnorr-based signatures, marking a significant advancement in Bitcoin technology. This effort is supported by demonstrations, collaborative meetings, and contributions from various organizations and individuals aiming to bridge the gap in Bitcoin's integration with FROST. Resources and further readings can be accessed at [Blockchain Commons' GitHub sponsors page](https://github.com/sponsors/BlockchainCommons).

0xB10C discusses enhancing Bitcoin nodes' security by detecting BGP attacks through the deployment of honeypot monitoring nodes and an external monitoring tool for Bitcoin Core. This proactive approach seeks to improve node resilience by accumulating crucial network data, emphasizing the importance of real-world data before implementation. More information can be found [here](https://b10c.me/projects/024-peer-observer/).

Lastly, the exploration of Simplicity as a blockchain programming language by roconnor-blockstream reveals its potential to handle complex computations securely and efficiently. Despite its minimalistic design, Simplicity supports practical functionalities and cryptographic operations, promising advancements in blockchain programming and smart contracts. The discussion underscores the language's evolution towards accommodating real-world applications and side-effects, indicating its comprehensive development approach. For more on Simplicity, visit [Delving Simplicity](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/delving-simplicity-part-building-data-types/1956).

recent_posts.title: Eclipsing Bitcoin Nodes with BGP Interception Attacks
recent_posts.summary:

- Honeypot nodes and an external tool for Bitcoin Core are suggested for gathering data.
- The approach aims at improving node resilience by analyzing behavior under different network conditions.

recent_posts.title: Delving Simplicity Part Ⅲ: Building Data Types
recent_posts.summary:
- Simplicity is explored for its potential in complex computations using basic types and combinators.

recent_posts.title: Confidential Script: Emulate soft forks using stateless TEEs
recent_posts.summary:
- The public crate with specific opcodes aims for integration into the Inquisition repository.
- A request is made for kernel support in Inquisition, seen as a logical step.
- The project focuses on security and user-friendliness, citing ShieldedCSV as an example.

active_posts.title: [BIP Proposal] Add BIP-0093 (Codex32) as application to BIP-0085
active_posts.summary:
- Ben Westgate proposes integrating BIP-0093 with BIP-0085 to improve deterministic wallet backups.
- The integration aims to generate codex32 backups directly from BIP-0032 master keys, enhancing security.
- Feedback is sought for the proposal, which includes test vectors and a draft PR for Bitcoin Core.

active_posts.title: [BIP Proposal] OP_TWEAKADD
active_posts.summary:
- Jeremy shared a draft BIP proposing OP_TWEAKADD to enhance Bitcoin scripting.
- The proposal opts for push semantics and allows flexible implementation of tweaks.
- Feedback is encouraged to refine the proposal within the Bitcoin development community.

active_posts.title: [BIP Proposal] Elliptic Curve Operations for Bitcoin Script
active_posts.summary:
- A proposal enhances Bitcoin's script with Elliptic Curve op codes via Taproot.
- The op codes enable dynamic smart contracts and diverse applications on Bitcoin.
- Technical details and a `btcd` reference implementation are available online.

active_posts.title: A simple backup scheme for wallet accounts
active_posts.summary:
- Josh's method differs in inscription and location features from another approach.
- The proposal recommends standardizing Salvatore's method, then adding Josh's unique aspects.
- This strategy aims to merge both methods' strengths for a comprehensive solution.

active_posts.title: Who will run the CoinJoin coordinators?
active_posts.summary:
- The crackdown on privacy tools alters Bitcoin privacy service landscapes, impacting Samourai and Wasabi Wallets.
- BTCPay Server's CoinJoin plugin, using WabiSabi, enables user-hosted privacy transactions, integrating with various wallets.
- The author introduces their own BTCPay coordinator to aid Bitcoin privacy, despite challenges in user adoption and guidance.

active_posts.title: CVE-2024-38365 public disclosure (btcd `FindAndDelete` bug)
active_posts.summary:
- Niklas Gögge and Antoine Poinsot found a significant flaw in Btcd software prior to v0.24.2.
- Their findings led to the correction of a script interpreter issue through a covert fix in PR 2178.
- The issue's resolution involved a diligent effort, ending with a responsible disclosure on September 20, 2024.

today_in_history_posts.title: Reorgs on SigNet - Looking for feedback on approach and parameters
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Anthony Towns initiated a discussion on signet's design and its block time distribution.
- Matt Corallo highlighted potential issues with changing block times on protocols like lightning.
- Signet is aimed at developers for testing and users for experiencing a near-live Bitcoin environment.

today_in_history_posts.title: Stateless invoices with proof-of-payment
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Stateless invoices eliminate the need for storage by allowing unlimited invoice generation.
- Custom tlv records or existing fields can identify payment details upon arrival.
- A deterministic preimage allows recipients to reconcile payments without prior knowledge.

today_in_history_posts.title: Public archive for Delving Bitcoin
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- The proposal introduces archiving site posts to prevent loss and improve searchability.
- Methods include scraping, API use, and database dumping, with API and dumping preferred.
- Final suggestion favors API or database methods, sharing results on a git repository.
